Useful Links

Below is a hand-picked and categorised list of resources that we used when learning to code and still refer back to frequently.

Introduction to R

Introduction to R, vectors, data frames and matrices http://tryr.codeschool.com
A collection of R code ranging from basics, data visualisation and stats http://sthda.com
A comprehensive online guide to using R http://www.cookbook-r.com/
A metablog of R tutorials http://www.r-bloggers.com
Videos from an online course on R (intro to R, data formatting, data visualisation) http://blog.revolutionanalytics.com/2012/12/coursera-videos.html
How to cite R and R packages in your assignment http://www.blopig.com/blog/2013/07/citing-r-packages-in-your-thesispaperassignments/

Graphics and Data Visualisation

Base Graphics in R: A Detailed Idiot’s Guide susanejohnston.wordpress.com/2013/08/30/base-graphics-in-r-a-detailed-idiots-guide/
Sample chapters from Hadley Wickham’s ggplot2 book ggplot2-book.org/
R colour values http://www.stat.columbia.edu/~tzheng/files/Rcolor.pdf
Graphics guide, mostly ggplot2. ase.tufts.edu/bugs/guide/assets/R%20Graphics%20Cookbook.pdf
Shiny tutorials shiny.rstudio.com

R Markdown, Version Control & Reproducible Research

An Introduction to Reproducible Research in R and RStudio susanejohnston.wordpress.com/2015/05/12/an-introduction-to-reproducible-research-in-r-and-r-studio/
Download LaTeX, find useful tutorials and guides www.latex-project.org
Github tutorial repository help.github.com/articles/good-resources-for-learning-git-and-github/
Markdown cheatsheet github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Here-Cheatsheet
R notebooks introduction video www.rstudio.com/resources/webinars/introducing-notebooks-with-r-markdown/
LaTeX math mode syntax reu.dimacs.rutgers.edu/Symbols.pdf
Concise guide to LaTeX programming https://tobi.oetiker.ch/lshort/lshort.pdf
British Ecological Society Guide to Data Management in Ecology and Evolution britishecologicalsociety.org/wp-content/uploads/Publ_Data-Management-Booklet.pdf
Materials for the version control and reproducible code workshops at the British Ecological Society 2016 Annual Meeting github.com/BES2016Workshop

Statistical Analysis

Standard textbook for biological statistics using R rcompanion.org/documents/RCompanionBioStatistics.pdf
Hadley Wickham's R for Data Science book r4ds.had.co.nz/
Linear models and linear mixed effects models in R: Tutorial by Bodo Winter www.bodowinter.com/tutorial/bw_LME_tutorial1.pdf
A very basic tutorial for performing linear mixed effects analyses by Bodo Winter www.bodowinter.com/tutorial/bw_LME_tutorial2.pdf

Data Manipulation

Seeing Theory: a stunning visual guide to statistics students.brown.edu/seeing-theory/index.html
The dplyr package and pipes seananderson.ca/2014/09/13/dplyr-intro.html
Data wrangling cheatsheet, dplyr and tidyr www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/data-wrangling-cheatsheet.pdf
Cheatsheets for ggplot, dplyr, Shiny, etc. www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/

Shiny

The official Shiny tutorial from RStudio http://shiny.rstudio.com/tutorial/

Fun Stuff

Submissions of arty data visualisation and goofs twitter.com/accidental__art
Funny illustration of how we all feel when coding lisacharlotterost.github.io/2016/09/29/learn-how-to-code/
A guide for aspiring video game programmers - recommended by one of our young users! ithare.com/programming-guide-for-video-gamers/

Troubleshooting

Ask Questions. stackoverflow.com

We are always looking for new ideas and feedback.

We are very keen to discuss ways to innovate teaching in quantitative analysis and are also happy to share our experience in creating and leading Coding Club. Feel free to contact us with any questions or feedback: we would really appreciate your input!

  • About Us

  • Follow us on Twitter

We are happy for people to use and further develop our tutorials - please give credit to Coding Club by linking to our website. We are also happy to discuss possible collaborations, so get in touch at ourcodingclub@gmail.com
